1: <sup>1</sup> Now Benjamin begat Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, and Aharah the third,
2: <sup>2</sup> Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.
3: <sup>3</sup> And the sons of Bela were, Addar, and Gera, and Abihud,
4: <sup>4</sup> And Abishua, and Naaman, and Ahoah,
5: <sup>5</sup> And Gera, and Shephuphan, and Huram.
6: <sup>6</sup> And these are the sons of Ehud: these are the heads of the fathers of the inhabitants of Geba, and they removed them to Manahath:
7: <sup>7</sup> And Naaman, and Ahiah, and Gera, he removed them, and begat Uzza, and Ahihud.
8: <sup>8</sup> And Shaharaim begat children in the country of Moab, after he had sent them away; Hushim and Baara were his wives.
9: <sup>9</sup> And he begat of Hodesh his wife, Jobab, and Zibia, and Mesha, and Malcham,
10: <sup>10</sup> And Jeuz, and Shachia, and Mirma. These were his sons, heads of the fathers.
11: <sup>11</sup> And of Hushim he begat Abitub, and Elpaal.
12: <sup>12</sup> The sons of Elpaal; Eber, and Misham, and Shamed, who built Ono, and Lod, with the towns thereof:
13: <sup>13</sup> Beriah also, and Shema, who were heads of the fathers of the inhabitants of Aijalon, who drove away the inhabitants of Gath:
15: <sup>15</sup> And Zebadiah, and Arad, and Ader,
16: <sup>16</sup> And Michael, and Ispah, and Joha, the sons of Beriah;
17: <sup>17</sup> And Zebadiah, and Meshullam, and Hezeki, and Heber,
18: <sup>18</sup> Ishmerai also, and Jezliah, and Jobab, the sons of Elpaal;
19: <sup>19</sup> And Jakim, and Zichri, and Zabdi,
20: <sup>20</sup> And Elienai, and Zilthai, and Eliel,
21: <sup>21</sup> And Adaiah, and Beraiah, and Shimrath, the sons of Shimhi;
22: <sup>22</sup> And Ishpan, and Heber, and Eliel,
23: <sup>23</sup> And Abdon, and Zichri, and Hanan,
24: <sup>24</sup> And Hananiah, and Elam, and Antothijah,
25: <sup>25</sup> And Iphedeiah, and Penuel, the sons of Shashak;
26: <sup>26</sup> And Shamsherai, and Shehariah, and Athaliah,
27: <sup>27</sup> And Jaresiah, and Eliah, and Zichri, the sons of Jeroham.
28: <sup>28</sup> These were heads of the fathers, by their generations, chief men. These dwelt in Jerusalem.
29: <sup>29</sup> And at Gibeon dwelt the father of Gibeon; whose wife’s name was Maachah:
30: <sup>30</sup> And his firstborn son Abdon, and Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Nadab,
31: <sup>31</sup> And Gedor, and Ahio, and Zacher.
32: <sup>32</sup> And Mikloth begat Shimeah. And these also dwelt with their brethren in Jerusalem, over against them.
33: <sup>33</sup> And Ner begat Kish, and Kish begat Saul, and Saul begat Jonathan, and Malchishua, and Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
34: <sup>34</sup> And the son of Jonathan was Meribbaal; and Meribbaal begat Micah.
35: <sup>35</sup> And the sons of Micah were, Pithon, and Melech, and Tarea, and Ahaz.
36: <sup>36</sup> And Ahaz begat Jehoadah; and Jehoadah begat Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri begat Moza,
37: <sup>37</sup> And Moza begat Binea: Rapha was his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son:
38: <sup>38</sup> And Azel had six sons, whose names are these, Azrikam, Bocheru, and Ishmael, and Sheariah, and Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
39: <sup>39</sup> And the sons of Eshek his brother were, Ulam his firstborn, Jehush the second, and Eliphelet the third.
40: <sup>40</sup> And the sons of Ulam were mighty men of valour, archers, and had many sons, and sons’ sons, an hundred and fifty. All these are of the sons of Benjamin.
